Have A Nice Day
  	
'Help, help, ' said a man. 'I'm drowning.'
'Hang on, ' said a man from the shore.
'Help, help, ' said the man. 'I'm not clowning.'
'Yes, I know, I heard you before.
Be patient dear man who is drowning,
You, see I've got a disease.
I'm waiting for a Doctor J. Browning.
So do be patient please.'
'How long, ' said the man who was drowning. 'Will it take for the Doc to arrive? '
'Not very long, ' said the man with the disease. 'Till then try staying alive.'
'Very well, ' said the man who was drowning. 'I'll try and stay afloat.
By reciting the poems of Browning
And other things he wrote.'
'Help, help, ' said the man with the disease, 'I suddenly feel quite ill.'
'Keep calm.' said the man who was drowning, ' Breathe deeply and lie quite still.'
'Oh dear, ' said the man with the awful disease. 'I think I'm going to die.'
'Farewell, ' said the man who was drowning.
Said the man with the disease, 'goodbye.'
So the man who was drowning, drownded
And the man with the disease past away.
But apart from that,
And a fire in my flat,
It's been a very nice day.

Spike Milligan

Whenever life gets you down, Mrs. Brown,
And things seem hard or tough,
And people are stupid, obnoxious or daft,
And you feel that you've had quite eno-o-o-o-o-ough,

Just remember that you're standing on a planet that's evolving
And revolving at nine hundred miles* an hour.
It's orbiting at nineteen miles a second, so it's reckoned,
The sun that is the source of all our power.
Now the sun, and you and me, and all the stars that we can see,
Are moving at a million miles a day,
In the outer spiral arm, at fourteen thousand miles an hour,
Of a galaxy we call the Milky Way.

Our galaxy itself contains a hundred billion stars;
It's a hundred thousand light-years side to side;
It bulges in the middle sixteen thousand light-years thick,
But out by us it's just three thousand light-years wide.
We're thirty thousand light-years from Galactic Central Point,
We go 'round every two hundred million years;
And our galaxy itself is one of millions of billions
In this amazing and expanding universe.

Our universe itself keeps on expanding and expanding,
In all of the directions it can whiz;
As fast as it can go, that's the speed of light, you know,
Twelve million miles a minute and that's the fastest speed there is.
So remember, when you're feeling very small and insecure,
How amazingly unlikely is your birth;
And pray that there's intelligent life somewhere out in space,



* As pointed out to me by Dr. Chu of the Astronomy Department at the U. of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, this value isn't quite right. She's correct: the earth is revolving at approximately 1030 miles per hour at its equator, and at 900 miles per hour only at a latitude of ~29 degrees (north or south). The closer you get to either pole, the less distance the earth needs to spin to complete one revolution, and so the slower it rotates. 

Hmm, I wonder if the other numbers are any more accurate...

Some people live life like the sun, with everyone revolving around them.  These people are fiery, exciting and yet though spectacular from a distance they are difficult to get close to.  no-one wants to go near them really, yet people live by them, rely on them, and feed on what they provide.  The "sun people" centre themselves and think themselves the most important thing in everyone else's life, providing energy to others and being the one source of all things, the one most powerful object in a life.  There is the inevitable rising of the sun, sometimes people have dark moments but they will rise again and routinely shine, get glory.  these are the pretty people, people who seek power and long for attention.  They look great from here, but i warn you, be careful.  With these people i advise that you keep your distance, and wear sunglasses so you can see them more clearly.  no matter how much time you enjoy spending with the sun, keep applying protective suncream.  you do not want this sun destroying parts of your life.  don't let it corrupt your life with cancers and sun burn.  never let the sun catch you crying.
make sense?

"A poem for Duncan - my dead Budgie"


I don't think anyone can understand, 
The love I felt for my little man 

He had to have been sent from above, 
My birdie with such unconditional love 

He asked for nothing but my time, 
Maybe to sing him a song,teach him a rhyme 

He brought me such happiness and bliss, 
I know there is so many things I'll miss 



The gentle way he preened my ear, 
How he got so excited just to have me near 

His sweet low song that woke me each day, 
All the words that he could say 

Feeding him his apple and pear, 
How he liked to snuggle under my hair 

How he said "mommys little guy", 
How much he enjoyed just one lullaby 

Why did he leave I wish I knew, 
Maybe God just needed someone to talk to 

I know he's gone but we'll never be apart, 
I'll always have him in my heart 

And no matter where I go I know he'll be there, 
Because now baby birdie can fly anywhere. 

(just to clarify, Duncan was not my budie, and i do not miss him. i also hope that wherever i go Duncan shall not be there.)
